e. o. lawrence.gloss: United States physicist who developed the cyclotron (1901-1958)

e. o. wilson.gloss: United States entomologist who has generalized from social insects to other animals including humans (born in 1929)

eocene.gloss: from 58 million to 40 million years ago

eocene epoch.gloss: from 58 million to 40 million years ago

eolian.gloss: a member of one of four linguistic divisions of the prehistoric Greeks

eolic.gloss: the dialect of Ancient Greek spoken in Thessaly and Boeotia and Aeolis

eolithic.gloss: the earliest part of the Stone Age marked by the earliest signs of human culture

eolithic age.gloss: the earliest part of the Stone Age marked by the earliest signs of human culture

eon.gloss: the longest division of geological time

eosin.gloss: a red fluorescent dye resulting from the action of bromine on fluorescein

eosinophil.gloss: a leukocyte readily stained with eosin

eosinophile.gloss: a leukocyte readily stained with eosin

eolotropic.gloss: having properties with different values along different axes

eonian.gloss: of or relating to a geological eon (longer than an era)
